oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery On The Record with George H. W. Bush and Barbara Bush
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of George H. W. Bush and Barbara Bush (performer) for Ralph Emery: On the Record With George and Barbara Bush. The recording is performed in front of a live audience. The recording is from February 20, 1995. The tape is labeled part 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; George H. W. Bush; Barbara Bush
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Barbara Bush and Ralph Emery discuss people's worries about safety -- (01:00) Emery introduces Barbara Bush and George H. W. Bush -- (01:41) Emery invites Barbara and George to reflect on their appreciation to Nashville -- (02:16) Emery recalls what Joe Bonsall believed of president Bush's vocals -- (03:12) Emery inquires as to how Barbara and George had first met, and Barbara and George discuss their first couple dates -- (05:32) Emery recalls how George feared a car without a radio, and Emery invites George to reflect on his service during his engagement -- (08:11) Barbara and George discuss their first kiss -- (09:08) Emery asks George to discuss his nickname 'Papi,' and Emery recalls the events of George's service -- (11:58) Emery asks about George's fear of death during his employment -- (15:04) Emery inquires about Barbara and George's support of the atomic bomb's use -- (17:59) Emery recalls how a Japanese plane got lost, and George recalls how a friend of his survived for days alone -- (19:02) George is invited to reflect on the psychosomatic affects of war -- (19:24) Emery invites Barbara and George to discuss their children -- (21:20) Emery brings up the fact that George is continuously called about running for president; additionally, Emery asks Barbara and George to reflect on Pauline Robinson Bush -- (27:53) Emery invites Barbara and George to discuss Barbara's literacy foundation, and Emery inquires about Millie Bush's fan club -- (31:27) Emery presents a picture of George and Barbara leaving church, dancing, and George's aviation ceremony -- (34:41) Emery praises George Bush's career while listing her various roles; additionally, George reflects on being in China for diplomatic missions -- (38:41) George and Barbara accredit Roy Acuff and Loretta Lynn to their early country tastes -- (44:05) Emery asks George and Barbara to reflect on how Roger Whittaker visited to the White House and formed a fan club -- (45:48) Emery inquires about how Barbara did not originally like the idea of George running for president; and Emery asks why George wished to be president -- (47:57) Emery asks as to why Barbara had two bibles during George's inauguration -- (48:37) Emery invites George and Barbara to reflect on trying to hold a conversation with Emperor Hirohito -- (51:24) Emery inquires about George's handling of the fall of the Berlin Wall -- (53:35) Emery inquires as to what George is up to at that moment -- (55:35) Barbara Bush reflects on her teaching endeavors -- (57:44) Emery expresses his thanks to Barbara and George, and all jokes about their previous meetings -- (59:13) Conversing away from the microphone occurs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bush, Barbara; Bush, George H.W.; Bush, George, 1924-;
